title: How to tell if a compound is organic - Quora

response.answer_text: For a long while it was believed that there was an inherent difference between compounds produced from minerals and those produced by living organisms. Then Wohler synthesised urea from mineral sources and the vitalism idea died. Now organic chemistry includes compounds of carbon except for a few like metal carbonates and carbides. The border is a bit fuzzy. If a chemical has a chain of C-C bonds then it is definitely organic.

Organic compounds usually contain carbon are usually at least partially covalent in bonding and respond to the usual techniques used by "Organic Chemists" to characterize and manipulate them. In the analysis of an unknown material that is usually not an immediate concern.
